thread.title: Environment Canada warns of possible flooding in Toronto Tuesday
thread.title_full: Environment Canada warns of possible flooding in Toronto Tuesday

title: Environment Canada warns of possible flooding in Toronto Tuesday
text:
#StarWeather Environment Canada warns of possible flooding in Toronto Tuesday Environment Canada has issued a special weather statement, saying Toronto can expect between 15 and 25 millimetres of rain between Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. The rain will start to move into the GTA at around 9 p.m., although some showers could start in the afternoon. ( Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press file photo ) By Salmaan Farooqui Staff Reporter Tues., Feb. 28, 2017 
Steady rain throughout Tuesday night and into Wednesday could cause flooding thanks to a still frozen ground, Environment Canada warns. 
Environment Canada has issued a special weather statement, saying Toronto can expect between 15 and 25 millimetres of rain between Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. 
That isn’t an absurdly high amount — Environment Canada meteorologist Mark Schuster says we get that multiple times a year — the ground is still frozen, which means it can’t absorb moisture as it normally would. 
Owners of property where flooding tends to be an issue should look out. 
Areas near rivers and streams are also at risk of higher water levels. Article Continued Below 
The rain will start to move into the GTA at around 9 p.m., although some showers could start in the afternoon. 
The rainy weather could last into midday Wednesday, with a possibility of lighter showers during the day. 
Despite all the rain, Torontonians will have one thing to look forward to: warmth. 
Tuesday is forecasted to have a high of 8 C, and Wednesday will get to a balmy 15 C. Both days are a lot higher than the seasonal average of 1 C. 
Don’t hold your breath over the warmth staying for long, though. Schuster reckons that temperatures will be back to below freezing by Thursday, and will stay around there until the end of the weekend.
